title: We Are Not Alone | Accepting What Is
description:
Ghosts are, of course, a silly thing to believe in (Athenodorus‚Äô ghost story notwithstanding). Yet the Stoics would not have scoffed at Eleanor Roosevelt‚Äôs feeling of not being alone in the Lincoln bedroom. As the New York Times would write many years ago in an editorial about her claim, ‚ÄúThe White House is built of memories‚Ä¶It will remain a haunted house as long as it stands, but only in the benign sense that unseen presences may still be watching the destiny of the Republic‚Ä¶What American, passing by that great pillared residence, in time of stress, could fail to feel reassured to sense the shadowy figure of Lincoln, just as Mrs. Roosevelt describes him, gazing thoughtfully from a window?‚Äù
